meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your boy here, ready to dive into the world of Wuthering Waves and give you the lowdown on this free-to-play gatcha game.

First off, let me just say that I'm impressed by Kuro Games' efforts to create a game that can stand out in a crowded market. I mean, it's not easy being the new kid on the block and trying to take down the Genshin Impact of the world (no pun intended). So kudos to them for at least trying.

Now, onto the gameplay itself. I've got to say that Wuthering Waves delivers some solid fun in terms of combat. It's fast-paced and action-packed, with a nice balance between exploration and fighting. The open-world aspect is also pretty cool, giving you plenty of room to roam and discover new things.

But let's get real for a second – the story is where this game falls short. I mean, it's not like it's bad or anything (I won't go as far as saying it's "Wuthering" terrible, haha), but it just doesn't quite hit the mark. And don't even get me started on the voice acting... let's just say that some of those characters sound like they're trying to give a lecture while simultaneously gargling with rocks.

Despite all this, I do think that Wuthering Waves has potential. With constant patches and updates (like the ones mentioned by Movies Games and Tech), it's clear that Kuro Games is committed to making improvements. And hey, at least the game isn't trying to copy Genshin Impact too closely – GLHF on Sports Illustrated gets a gold star for pointing out the "would-be usurper" vibes.

So what's the verdict? Well, I'm not gonna give you a score (shocking, I know). But if you're looking for a fun action game with some decent exploration, Wuthering Waves might just be worth your time. Just don't go in expecting a masterpiece story or voice acting – that's just not this game's strong suit.

Thanks for reading, folks! Hippo Penny out!
